generated_json.title: Chief Complaint
content: Knee pain progressing to pelvic bone pain with stiffness and weakness

generated_json.title: History of Present Illness
content: The patient reports a history of left knee injury in April, followed by right shoulder pain. Subsequently, pelvic bone pain developed, described as a 'locking' sensation. The pain began as mild but became constant and severe over three weeks. The patient attributes the onset to overcompensation after the initial injury. The pain persisted during a two-week trip to Hawaii, where the patient hobbled despite the discomfort. The patient consulted Dr. Savage, who suspected a possible avascular necrosis due to chronic pain. An MRI confirmed the diagnosis of avascular necrosis. The patient experienced significant pain relief after the MRI and subsequent treatment. The patient was advised to continue physical therapy and avoid high-impact activities. The patient also reported stiffness when transitioning from sitting to standing and ongoing weakness in the lower extremities. Dr. Savage had previously recommended an MRI and suspected avascular necrosis, but did not disclose this until after results were available. The patient expressed concern about potential progression to arthritis and knee replacement, though the provider noted this is rare. The patient is currently on a rehabilitation plan with physical therapy and is expected to improve over the next few months.
generated_json.instruction:
Provide a detailed summary of the patient's current illness based on their report. Include a thorough description of symptoms, noting their onset, duration, and severity or intensity. Discuss any changes or developments in symptoms since their onset and identify factors that may exacerbate or relate to these symptoms, such as specific activities, foods, or medications. Document any prior treatments or remedies the patient has attempted, noting their efficacy. Describe how these symptoms impact the patient's daily activities, overall well-being, and quality of life. Capture information about any individuals mentioned by the patient, specifying their relationship and any pertinent interactions or conversations related to the illness.

Please recheck the sentence and correct any grammatical errors in the following medical-related template. Ensure clarity, professionalism, and proper medical terminology while maintaining a concise and structured format 

End the sentence with period.

generated_json.instruction: Document the patient's current medications in the following format: Begin with the full generic name of each medication, followed by the brand name in parentheses if applicable (e.g., "Aspirin (Bayer)"). Specify the dosage strength (e.g., "81 mg") and indicate the frequency of administration (e.g., "Once daily"). Describe the route of administration, such as oral, topical, or by injection (e.g., "Oral Aspirin"). Lastly, for ongoing medications, note the duration for which the patient has been taking each medication (e.g., "on Aspirin for 3 weeks"). If no current medications are reported, document "No current medications found."

sub-section.title: Plan
content: Continue physical therapy for lower extremity strengthening and mobility. Avoid high-impact activities such as jogging or jumping. Monitor for recurrence or progression. Schedule follow-up in 2–3 months to assess functional improvement. Reassess need for further imaging or intervention if symptoms worsen. Encourage adherence to prescribed exercises. Refer to physical therapy for comprehensive rehabilitation program. Educate patient on prognosis: most cases improve with time and conservative management.
